name: Physical Geography
description: This physical geography course introduces earth systems processes occurring in and between the atmosphere, lithosphere, hydrosphere and the biosphere. It addresses human interaction and interference with the natural environment and compares natural and anthropogenic environmental changes. Key tools used to understand earth systems and the natural environment including hands-on empirical approaches, systems models, remote sensing, and geographical information systems are addressed in both the lectures and the practical sessions. This course fulfills 1 field day. [24L, 12P]
